content.p1: Prabhat Samgiita are spiritual songs composed by Shrii Shrii Anandamurti. They carry deep spiritual meaning and aid in meditative practice.
content.p2: These songs combine music, poetry, and philosophy, creating a unique path for spiritual development.

page03.title: Samgacchhadham Mantra
page03.mantra:
Samgacchhadhvam samvadadhvam
Sam vo manamsi janatam
Deva bhagam yatha purve
Sanjnanana upasate
page03.meaning: Move together! Let your words be united! May your minds be as one! Just as the ancient gods shared the abundance of the universe, may you also be united in wisdom and harmony.

page08.title: Supreme Command
page08.mantra:
"In the mind of those who perform sadhana regularly twice a day, at the time of death, a thought
of Parama Purusha will surely arise â€“ they will certainly attain liberation.
Therefore, every Ananda Margi should perform sadhana twice a day â€“ this is the command of Parama Purusha.

Without observing yama and niyama, sadhana is impossible,
therefore it is necessary to strictly adhere to these principles.
Not following this command means subjecting oneself
to the torments of animal life for tens of millions of years.
So that no one experiences such suffering,
and all may have the opportunity to enjoy
eternal peace under the loving shelter of Parama Purusha,
every Ananda Margi should strive to bring all onto the path of bliss.

This is an integral part of sadhana - to lead others on the path of righteousness."


Shrii Shrii Anandamurti

content.p1: Svadhyaya (self-study) is the second niyama in the yoga system. It includes the study of spiritual literature, sacred texts, and reflection on their meaning.
content.p2: Through svadhyaya, the practitioner deepens their understanding of spiritual principles and approaches the realization of their true nature. It is not just reading, but deep immersion in spiritual knowledge.

content.p1: Spiritual discussion (satsang) is a gathering with spiritual seekers, where questions of spiritual development, philosophy, and practice are discussed.
content.p2: Satsang literally means "communion with truth" or "gathering of truth". It is a time for sharing experiences, asking questions, and receiving spiritual guidance.
content.p3: In an atmosphere of mutual support and understanding, participants strengthen their spiritual practice and are inspired for further growth.

content.p1: Namaskar is a traditional Indian greeting that means "I bow to the divine in you". It is an expression of respect and recognition of the spiritual essence in every being.
content.p2: In the practice of yoga and meditation, namaskar serves as a reminder that beneath external differences, we are all united in our spiritual nature.
